message.raw:
Fixed bug with NI card where a shot with waits would not transition to static.
This is because the waits must be processed before processing the analogue traces, and thus the "WaitMonitorWorker" must be transitioned to static first.
message.html:

This is because the waits must be processed before processing the analogue traces, and thus the "WaitMonitorWorker" must be transitioned to static first.

message.raw:
Fixed bugs in devices
 * NovaTechDDS9M: Updated clock_limit attribute to match hardware limitations
 * PulseBlaster: Fixed bug where DDS direct_outputs were not being processed
 * RFBlaster: Reordered classes to resolve NameError and updated parent class to PseudoclockDevice
 * ZaberStageController: Fixed missnig numpy import

* PulseBlaster: Fixed bug where DDS direct_outputs were not being processed

* ZaberStageController: Fixed missnig numpy import

message.raw:
Lots of refactoring of DDSs.

DDSs had many references to specific classes for their parent devices, and their behaviour was
slightly different depending on what parent device they had. This has been solved in a few ways.

For DDSs attached to a PhaseMatrixQuickSyn, there is now a subclass of DDS,
labscript_utils.PhaseMatrixQuickSyn.QuickSynDDS, which supports only frequency
control and only static gating.

For Novatechs, one should still use DDS and StaticDDS, but they call methods on
the parents asking questions about how to initialise, such as whether a certain
unit conversion class should be used if the user hasn't specified one. If the parent
does not implement this method get_default_unit_conversion_classes(), it is ignored,
so this is backward compatible.

For PulseBlasters, DDS is also still the class to use, however the creation of a
DigitalQuantity for its gating is now done in the PulseBlaster's add_device method.

In order to facilitate this, Device.__init__ now takes an argument call_parents_add_device,
which, if set to false, means Device.__init__ will not call parent_device.add_device.

This allows subclasses more control over when parent_device.add_device is called
in their own __init__ method, although it remains the case that they *must* call it
at some point in their __init__ method if they tell Device.__init__ not to.

This commit corresponds to a simultaneous one in the labscript module which
implements part of this change.
message.html:
Lots of refactoring of DDSs.

DDSs had many references to specific classes for their parent devices, and their behaviour was
slightly different depending on what parent device they had. This has been solved in a few ways.

For DDSs attached to a PhaseMatrixQuickSyn, there is now a subclass of DDS,
labscript_utils.PhaseMatrixQuickSyn.QuickSynDDS, which supports only frequency
control and only static gating.

For Novatechs, one should still use DDS and StaticDDS, but they call methods on
the parents asking questions about how to initialise, such as whether a certain
unit conversion class should be used if the user hasn't specified one. If the parent
does not implement this method get_default_unit_conversion_classes(), it is ignored,
so this is backward compatible.

For PulseBlasters, DDS is also still the class to use, however the creation of a
DigitalQuantity for its gating is now done in the PulseBlaster's add_device method.

In order to facilitate this, Device.init now takes an argument call_parents_add_device,
which, if set to false, means Device.init will not call parent_device.add_device.

This allows subclasses more control over when parent_device.add_device is called
in their own init method, although it remains the case that they must call it
at some point in their init method if they tell Device.init not to.

This commit corresponds to a simultaneous one in the labscript module which
implements part of this change.

values.message:
Lots of refactoring of DDSs.

DDSs had many references to specific classes for their parent devices, and their behaviour was
slightly different depending on what parent device they had. This has been solved in a few ways.

For DDSs attached to a PhaseMatrixQuickSyn, there is now a subclass of DDS,
labscript_utils.PhaseMatrixQuickSyn.QuickSynDDS, which supports only frequency
control and only static gating.

For Novatechs, one should still use DDS and StaticDDS, but they call methods on
the parents asking questions about how to initialise, such as whether a certain
unit conversion class should be used if the user hasn't specified one. If the parent
does not implement this method get_default_unit_conversion_classes(), it is ignored,
so this is backward compatible.

For PulseBlasters, DDS is also still the class to use, however the creation of a
DigitalQuantity for its gating is now done in the PulseBlaster's add_device method.

In order to facilitate this, Device.__init__ now takes an argument call_parents_add_device,
which, if set to false, means Device.__init__ will not call parent_device.add_device.

This allows subclasses more control over when parent_device.add_device is called
in their own __init__ method, although it remains the case that they *must* call it
at some point in their __init__ method if they tell Device.__init__ not to.

This commit corresponds to a simultaneous one in the labscript module which
implements part of this change.
